name.text: Interactive: Frequency table for the time taken and a Histogram and frequency polygon

questiontext.text:
(a) A teacher used the school’s Learning Management System (LMS) to record the time, in minutes, that students took to finish a Math CAT assessment.
Complete the table by calculating the frequency density for each time interval.


Range \([min]\) Frequency Frequency Density
\(0 < t \leq {@first(second(data))@}\) {@third(first(data))*first(first(widthList))@} [[input:ans1]]
\({@first(second(data))@} < t \leq {@first(third(data))@}\) {@third(second(data))*first(second(widthList))@} [[input:ans2]]
\({@first(third(data))@} < t \leq {@first(fourth(data))@}\) {@third(third(data))*first(third(widthList))@} [[input:ans3]]
\({@first(fourth(data))@} < t \leq {@first(fifth(data))@}\) {@third(fourth(data))*first(fourth(widthList))@} [[input:ans4]]
\({@first(fifth(data))@} < t \leq {@first(sixth(data))@}\) {@third(fifth(data))*first(fifth(widthList))@} [[input:ans5]]
\({@first(sixth(data))@} < t \leq 60\) {@third(sixth(data))*(60-first(sixth(data)))@} [[input:ans6]]

[[validation:ans1]] [[validation:ans2]] [[validation:ans3]] [[validation:ans4]] [[validation:ans5]] [[validation:ans6]]

[[feedback:prt1]]


(b) By dragging the red points, complete the histogram below to represent the distribution of times taken by students to complete the Math CAT Mark assessment.


[[jsxgraph width="750px" height="450px" input-ref-ans7="sR1" input-ref-ans8="sR2" input-ref-ans9="sR3" input-ref-ans10="sR4" input-ref-ans11="sR5" input-ref-ans12="sR6" ]] JXG.Options.text.useMathJax = true; // Class ranges [min, max] var ranges = [ [0, {#second(first(data))#}], [{#first(second(data))#}, {#second(second(data))#}], [{#first(third(data))#}, {#second(third(data))#}], [{#first(fourth(data))#}, {#second(fourth(data))#}], [{#first(fifth(data))#}, {#second(fifth(data))#}], [{#first(sixth(data))#}, 60] ]; // Create board var board = JXG.JSXGraph.initBoard(divid, { boundingBox: [-5, 50, 65, -3], grid: true, showNavigation: false, showCopyright: false }); // Axes var yAxis = board.create("axis", [[0, 0], [0, 50]], { name: "\\(fd\\)", withLabel: true }); var xAxis = board.create("axis", [[0, 0], [40, 0]], { name: "\\(t\\,[min]\\)", withLabel: true }); // Vertical guide segments var segList = []; for (var i = 0; i < ranges.length; i++) { segList.push( board.create("segment", [ [(ranges[i][0] + ranges[i][1]) / 2, 0], [(ranges[i][0] + ranges[i][1]) / 2, 40] ], { fixed: true, visible: false }) ); } // Draggable frequency density points var pointList = []; for (i = 0; i < ranges.length; i++) { pointList.push( board.create("glider", [ (ranges[i][0] + ranges[i][1]) / 2, 0, segList[i] ], { size: 4, snapToGrid: true, showInfoBox: false, withLabel: false }) ); } // Histogram rectangles var lineListHori = []; for (i = 0; i < ranges.length; i++) { lineListHori.push( board.create("parallel", [pointList[i], xAxis], { fixed: true, visible: false }) ); } var lineListVert = [ board.create("parallel", [[ranges[0][0], 0], yAxis], { fixed: true, visible: false }) ]; for (i = 0; i < ranges.length; i++) { lineListVert.push( board.create("parallel", [[ranges[i][1], 0], yAxis], { fixed: true, visible: false }) ); } for (i = 0; i < pointList.length; i++) { board.create("polygon", [ [ranges[i][0], 0], [ranges[i][1], 0], board.create("intersection", [lineListHori[i], lineListVert[i + 1]], { visible: false }), board.create("intersection", [lineListHori[i], lineListVert[i]], { visible: false }) ], { fixed: true, highlight: false, vertices: { visible: false } }); } // ----------------------------- // Frequency polygon (FINAL) // ----------------------------- // Endpoints on x-axis var startPoint = board.create("point", [ranges[0][0], 0], { fixed: true, visible: false }); var endPoint = board.create("point", [ranges[ranges.length - 1][1], 0], { fixed: true, visible: false }); // Midpoints of bars var midPoints = []; for (i = 0; i < ranges.length; i++) { midPoints.push( board.create("point", [ (ranges[i][0] + ranges[i][1]) / 2, function (j) { return function () { return pointList[j].Y(); }; }(i) ], { fixed: true, visible: false }) ); } // Polygon segments board.create("segment", [startPoint, midPoints[0]], { strokeColor: "black", strokeWidth: 3, fixed: true }); for (i = 1; i < midPoints.length; i++) { board.create("segment", [midPoints[i - 1], midPoints[i]], { strokeColor: "black", strokeWidth: 3, fixed: true }); } board.create("segment", [midPoints[midPoints.length - 1], endPoint], { strokeColor: "black", strokeWidth: 3, fixed: true }); // STACK bindings stack_jxg.bind_point(sR1, pointList[0]); stack_jxg.bind_point(sR2, pointList[1]); stack_jxg.bind_point(sR3, pointList[2]); stack_jxg.bind_point(sR4, pointList[3]); stack_jxg.bind_point(sR5, pointList[4]); stack_jxg.bind_point(sR6, pointList[5]); board.unsuspendUpdate(); [[/jsxgraph]]

[[input:ans7]] [[input:ans8]] [[input:ans9]] [[input:ans10]] [[input:ans11]] [[input:ans12]]

[[validation:ans7]] [[validation:ans8]] [[validation:ans9]] [[validation:ans10]] [[validation:ans11]] [[validation:ans12]]


[[feedback:prt2]]


(c) Estimate the number of students who completed the Math CAT Mark assessment in less than 20 minutes.

[[input:ans13]] [[validation:ans13]]

[[feedback:prt3]]

generalfeedback.text:
Worked Solution


(a)

Using the relationship \( \text{frequency density} = \frac{\text{frequency}}{\text{class width}}, \)

the frequency density for each time interval can be calculated by dividing the number of students by the width of the corresponding time interval.


Time taken (min) Number of students Frequency density
\(0 < t \leq {@first(second(data))@}\) {@third(first(data))*first(first(widthList))@} \(\frac{{@third(first(data))*first(first(widthList))@}}{{@first(second(data))@}} = {@tans1@}\)
\({@first(second(data))@} < t \leq {@first(third(data))@}\) {@third(second(data))*first(second(widthList))@} \(\frac{{@third(second(data))*first(second(widthList))@}}{{@first(third(data))-first(second(data))@}} = {@tans2@}\)
\({@first(third(data))@} < t \leq {@first(fourth(data))@}\) {@third(third(data))*first(third(widthList))@} \(\frac{{@third(third(data))*first(third(widthList))@}}{{@first(fourth(data))-first(third(data))@}} = {@tans3@}\)
\({@first(fourth(data))@} < t \leq {@first(fifth(data))@}\) {@third(fourth(data))*first(fourth(widthList))@} \(\frac{{@third(fourth(data))*first(fourth(widthList))@}}{{@first(fifth(data))-first(fourth(data))@}} = {@tans4@}\)
\({@first(fifth(data))@} < t \leq {@first(sixth(data))@}\) {@third(fifth(data))*first(fifth(widthList))@} \(\frac{{@third(fifth(data))*first(fifth(widthList))@}}{{@first(sixth(data))-first(fifth(data))@}} = {@tans5@}\)
\({@first(sixth(data))@} < t \leq 60\) {@third(sixth(data))*(60-first(sixth(data)))@} \(\frac{{@third(sixth(data))*(60-first(sixth(data)))@}}{{@60-first(sixth(data))@}} = {@tans6@}\)


(b) The completed histogram below represents the distribution of the time taken by students to complete the Math CAT Mark assessment.

[[jsxgraph width="750px" height="450px" input-ref-ans7="sR1" input-ref-ans8="sR2" input-ref-ans9="sR3" input-ref-ans10="sR4" input-ref-ans11="sR5" input-ref-ans12="sR6"]] // [min, max] var ranges = [ [0, {#second(first(data))#}], [{#first(second(data))#}, {#second(second(data))#}], [{#first(third(data))#}, {#second(third(data))#}], [{#first(fourth(data))#}, {#second(fourth(data))#}], [{#first(fifth(data))#}, {#second(fifth(data))#}], [{#first(sixth(data))#}, 60], ]; JXG.Options.text.useMathJax=true; var board = JXG.JSXGraph.initBoard(divid, { boundingBox:[-5,15,65,-3], showCopyright:false, showNavigation:false, keepAspectRatio:false, grid:true }); // Defining axes var yAxis = board.create("axis", [[0,0], [0,50]], { highlight:false, name:"\\(fd\\)", withLabel:true, label:{ fixed:true, // Set fixed to true highlight:false, fontSize:15, position:"rt", offset:[-20,-20], anchorX:"right", useMathJax:true, parse:false }, ticks:{ label:{ highlight:false, anchorX:"right", offset:[-10,0] } } }); var xAxis = board.create("axis", [[0,0], [40,0]], { highlight:false, name:"\\(t \\ [min]\\)", withLabel:true, label:{ fixed:true, // Set fixed to true highlight:false, fontSize:15, position:"rt", offset:[0,-40], anchorX:"right", useMathJax:true, parse:false }, ticks:{ label:{ highlight:false, anchorX:"middle", offset:[0,-15] } } }); var i; // Vertical segments along which gliding points can move var segList = []; for (i in ranges) { segList.push(board.create("segment", [ [(ranges[i][0]+ranges[i][1])/2, 0], [(ranges[i][0]+ranges[i][1])/2, 14] ], { fixed:true, // Set fixed to true visible:false })); }; // User movable gliders var pointList = []; for (i in ranges) { pointList.push(board.create("glider", [(ranges[i][0]+ranges[i][1])/2, 0, segList[i]], { showInfoBox:false, size:4, snapToGrid:true, withLabel:false })); }; // Constructing rectangles from glider points var constStyle = { fixed:true, // Set fixed to true visible:false }; var lineListHori = []; for (i in ranges) { lineListHori.push(board.create("parallel", [ pointList[i], xAxis ], constStyle)); }; var lineListVert = [ board.create("parallel", [ [ranges[0][0], 0], yAxis ], constStyle) ]; for (i in ranges) { lineListVert.push(board.create("parallel", [ [ranges[i][1], 0], yAxis ], constStyle)); }; var interList = []; for (i = 0; i < pointList.length; i++) { interList.push([ board.create("intersection", [ lineListHori[i], lineListVert[i] ], constStyle), board.create("intersection", [ lineListHori[i], lineListVert[i+1] ], constStyle) ]); }; for (i = 0; i < pointList.length; i++) { board.create("polygon", [ [ranges[i][0], 0], [ranges[i][1], 0], interList[i][1], interList[i][0] ], { fixed:true, // Set fixed to true highlight:false, vertices:{ fixed:true, // Set fixed to true visible:false }, borders:{ fixed:true, // Set fixed to true highlight:false } }) }; // ----------------------------- // Frequency polygon (FINAL) // ----------------------------- // Endpoints on x-axis var startPoint = board.create("point", [ranges[0][0], 0], { fixed: true, visible: false }); var endPoint = board.create("point", [ranges[ranges.length - 1][1], 0], { fixed: true, visible: false }); // Midpoints of bars var midPoints = []; for (i = 0; i < ranges.length; i++) { midPoints.push( board.create("point", [ (ranges[i][0] + ranges[i][1]) / 2, function (j) { return function () { return pointList[j].Y(); }; }(i) ], { fixed: true, visible: false }) ); } // Polygon segments board.create("segment", [startPoint, midPoints[0]], { strokeColor: "black", strokeWidth: 3, fixed: true }); for (i = 1; i < midPoints.length; i++) { board.create("segment", [midPoints[i - 1], midPoints[i]], { strokeColor: "black", strokeWidth: 3, fixed: true }); } board.create("segment", [midPoints[midPoints.length - 1], endPoint], { strokeColor: "black", strokeWidth: 3, fixed: true }); stack_jxg.bind_point(sR1, pointList[0]); stack_jxg.bind_point(sR2, pointList[1]); stack_jxg.bind_point(sR3, pointList[2]); stack_jxg.bind_point(sR4, pointList[3]); stack_jxg.bind_point(sR5, pointList[4]); stack_jxg.bind_point(sR6, pointList[5]); board.unsuspendUpdate(); [[/jsxgraph]]

(c) To estimate the number of students who completed the Math CAT Mark assessment in less than 20 minutes, we consider the interval \(0 < t \leq 20\).

This interval consists of complete class intervals from part (a), together with a partial interval \( {@if first(sixth(data))<20 then first(sixth(data)) else if first(fifth(data))<20 then first(fifth(data)) else if first(fourth(data))<20 then first(fourth(data)) else if first(third(data))<20 then first(third(data)) else if first(second(data))<20 then first(second(data)) else if first(first(data))<20 then first(first(data))@} < t \leq 20. \)

The number of students in this partial interval is estimated by finding the area of the corresponding section of the histogram.

Using this approach, the estimated number of students in the partial interval is \( {@if first(sixth(data))<20 then (20-first(sixth(data)))*third(sixth(data)) else if first(fifth(data))<20 then (20-first(fifth(data)))*third(fifth(data)) else if first(fourth(data))<20 then (20-first(fourth(data)))*third(fourth(data)) else if first(third(data))<20 then (20-first(third(data)))*third(third(data)) else if first(second(data))<20 then (20-first(second(data)))*third(second(data)) else if first(first(data))<20 then (20-first(first(data)))*third(first(data))@}. \)

Therefore, the estimated total number of students who completed the assessment in less than 20 minutes is \( {@if first(sixth(data))<20 then sconcat(first(first(widthList))*tans1, "+", first(second(widthList))*tans2, "+", first(third(widthList))*tans3, "+", first(fourth(widthList))*tans4, "+", first(fifth(widthList))*tans5 , "+", (20-first(sixth(data)))*third(sixth(data))) else if first(fifth(data))<20 then sconcat(first(first(widthList))*tans1, "+", first(second(widthList))*tans2, "+", first(third(widthList))*tans3, "+", first(fourth(widthList))*tans4, "+", (20-first(fifth(data)))*third(fifth(data))) else if first(fourth(data))<20 then sconcat(first(first(widthList))*tans1, "+", first(second(widthList))*tans2, "+", first(third(widthList))*tans3, "+", (20-first(fourth(data)))*third(fourth(data))) else if first(third(data))<20 then sconcat(first(first(widthList))*tans1, "+", first(second(widthList))*tans2, "+", (20-first(third(data)))*third(third(data))) else if first(second(data))<20 then sconcat(first(first(widthList))*tans1, "+", (20-first(second(data)))*third(second(data))) else if first(first(data))<20 then (20-first(sixth(data)))*third(sixth(data))@} = {@tans13@}. \)

questionnote.text:
{@data@}

\(0 < t \leq {@first(second(data))@}\)

\({@first(second(data))@} < t \leq {@first(third(data))@}\)

\({@first(third(data))@} < t \leq {@first(fourth(data))@}\)

\({@first(fourth(data))@} < t \leq {@first(fifth(data))@}\)

\({@first(fifth(data))@} < t \leq {@first(sixth(data))@}\)

\({@first(sixth(data))@} < t \leq 60\)

questiondescription.text:
Daniel Murunga

Given a frequency table for the time taken by students to complete a Math CAT Mark assessment on the school’s learning management system, the student is required to complete the histogram shown below to represent the distribution of completion times.

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.

Checks for correct answer

node.description: Checks for correct answer
Checks for correct answer
Checks for all included students

truefeedback.text:
You have included all of the students in the \({@if first(sixth(data))<20 then first(sixth(data)) else if first(fifth(data))<20 then first(fifth(data)) else if first(fourth(data))<20 then first(fourth(data)) else if first(third(data))<20 then first(third(data)) else if first(second(data))<20 then first(second(data)) else if first(first(data))<20 then 0@} < t \leq {@if first(sixth(data))<20 then 60 else if first(fifth(data))<20 then second(fifth(data)) else if first(fourth(data))<20 then second(fourth(data)) else if first(third(data))<20 then second(third(data)) else if first(second(data))<20 then second(second(data)) else if first(first(data))<20 then second(first(data))@}\) range.
However, some of the students' journeys in this range are longer than 20 minutes.

node.description: Checks for not all included students

truefeedback.text:
You have not included any of the students in the \({@if first(sixth(data))<20 then first(sixth(data)) else if first(fifth(data))<20 then first(fifth(data)) else if first(fourth(data))<20 then first(fourth(data)) else if first(third(data))<20 then first(third(data)) else if first(second(data))<20 then first(second(data)) else if first(first(data))<20 then 0@} < t \leq {@if first(sixth(data))<20 then 60 else if first(fifth(data))<20 then second(fifth(data)) else if first(fourth(data))<20 then second(fourth(data)) else if first(third(data))<20 then second(third(data)) else if first(second(data))<20 then second(second(data)) else if first(first(data))<20 then second(first(data))@}\) range.
However, some of the students' journeys in this range are shorter than 20 minutes.
